data: Do not use for burn-injured patients
Do not insert FMS if any contraindications are present as per policy
Nurse to remove rectal devices (i.e. rectal probe).
Provide rectal check pre-insertion to rule out fecal impaction, to test for anal sphincter muscle tone and to rule out stricture.
Indication: to CONTAIN infectious stool, once constipation or impaction has been ruled out
Indication: to PREVENT skin breakdown, once constipation or impaction has been ruled out
Indication: to PROTECT surgical wounds, once constipation or impaction has been ruled out
Do not insert any rectal devices (e.g. rectal probe) or any rectal medications
Monitor position of black indicator line q6h and document as per FMS Clinical Practice Document. If needed, reposition FMS as per policy.
If stool output is less than 300 mL in 12 hours, notify provider and discuss discontinuation of FMS
If stool is soft, semi-formed, solid, or less than 300 mL in 12 hours and if FMS has been in situ for 29 days, notify provider and discuss discontinuation of FMS
Other (please specify), no greater than 30 degrees
Discontinue ICU Bowel Protocol for all non-burn related FMS insertions
Urgent, Reason: to rule out constipation or impaction
